Question
========
Which of the following are examples of **missing values** in R? Select all that apply.

Answerlist
----------
* `NA`
* `NaN`
* `NULL`
* `""` (empty string)

Solution
========
`NA` is the standard missing value in R. `NaN` can arise from undefined numeric operations (e.g., `0/0`). `NULL` means “no value” and `""` is an empty string, not missing.
